One of the best Airbnbâ€™s weâ€™ve stayed in! I donâ€™t think youâ€™ll find a better place location-wise in the park. If you want to visit the coast, the rainforest, the lake, or Port Angeles, this place is right in the middle of it all - which is important because itâ€™s a huge park that requires a bit of driving to see everything.
The house is exactly as you see it in pictures. A quaint getaway with a wonderful fireplace that warms the main room to the coziest degree. The porch opens to the Sol Duc, a blue river in the midst of mossy green trees and the relaxing sound of moving water right outside your door. We took full advantage of the upgraded hot tub and cooked hot dogs over the fire.
There arenâ€™t a ton of food options on the peninsula, but luckily Amber has the house stocked with everything needed to make a meal, including a variety of spices. We picked up provisions in Forks and cooked salmon and steak each night!
Amber even came out within 30 min to help with the fireplace.

My husband and I were in need of a getaway. Amber's cabin was exactly what we were looking for! The location is central to a lot of landmarks that we were interested in exploring. We stayed 3 nights and we were able to visit Kalaloch Beach, Ruby Beach, Rialto Beach, Lake Crescent, Hall of Mosses, Forks and Cape Flattery. The longest drive was a little over an hour.
The cabin was exactly as described. Tucked away from the highway and overlooking the river. I was able to make my way down to the river for some amazing sunset pictures. We had no complaints! Bed was comfy, living room and kitchen have everything you need (no microwave, but we didn't need it).
Finally, let's talk about the hot tub! Sometimes we come across these magical settings that we want to experience for our self....this is it! The hot tub is as close to the river as it can get. We enjoyed every minute looking at the scenery and listening to the sounds of the river. We will be back!

review_text: If you're looking for a place in Port Angeles, look no further. Shellay & Michaels quaint little cabin was one of the best AirBnBs we've ever stayed in. The bed was 5-star, the turkish robes and bath towels were what dreams are made of, and we woke up to a herd of deer out our window. The hosts thought about every little detail, and it showed. The cabin was well-equipped with everything you might need (there is even a fan in the closet for those who need the noise for sleep), there was a lovely coffee and tea selection, and the tackle box full of smores ingredients was a wonderful touch (it was snowing, so we didn't take advantage of the fire pit, but we might have snuck a Hershey's bar or two.) There was a "junk drawer" full of handy odds and ends, and the bathroom was stocked full with the little things that help make an overnight stay successful. Check this place out; I promise, you will NOT be disappointed!

This was our favorite stay - a real hidden gem - among many on a road trip from coastal Washington through central Oregon. Shellay and Michael have created a wonderful experience for anyone lucky enough to book a stay here. This was the first time I have ever stayed in an AirBnB and have it feel as comfortable as my own home.
The personal touches in this AirBnB blew my partner and I away. Shellay and Michael have anticipated every need that guests might have, including (adorably) a s'mores kit complete with several kinds of chocolate, marshmallows, and graham crackers for guests who choose to use the outdoor fire pit.
We were sad to leave after only one night at this AirBnB. Next time we visit the Olympic Peninsula, we will definitely try to book the space again, and for a longer stay. Highly recommend!

Loved sitting on the deck listening to geese fly by at night and the view of mountains and cows out the dining area windows.
We would definitely return if we ever make it back to the PNW!

We loved the extra thought put into having supplies for our pup ( blankets, towels, bowls, etc). We had good cell service (T-mobile) for the occasional check in. We didn't miss having wifi as this location is a perfect place to disconnect from technology and reconnect with family. Thank you Suzie!

review_text: This house was in such a peaceful locationâ€”quiet, dark at night, and lots of open expanse. Great location for sites near Sequim and Port Angeles. The house is very tastefully decorated and the owners thought of everything you might need. We enjoyed the sâ€™mores supplies left for us, as well as grilling outside (briquettes were on site). There were raspberries and currants ripe for picking when we were there and fun things for our 8-year old to explore. As a city family, it was a welcome chance to simply slow down. The CD collection was novel for our son and kept him entertained for hours! My husband even enjoyed a massage from Suzie while at the house, which was an unexpected bonus, since Suzie is a massage professional and has a cute studio on site. Highly recommend Hurricane Ridge at sunrise, Dungeness National Wildlife Refuge any time, and the Dungeness Valley Creamery to see the cows and try ice cream and raw milk. Berry picking at Graymarsh Farm was also a treat. Thank you for a memorable stay.

review_text: DO NOT STAY WITH THIS HOST! My 1st bad Airbnb review. Facts: I gave her 2hr notice when I would arrive. She did not heat the RV for me. I had to search for 1 tiny space heater. Upon arrival, it was 50deg in the RV. She told me that it would warm up with both heaters on high. It never got warmer than 53 deg, and the water ran dry due to frozen pipes. I used my own water that I brought, in order to use the toilet properly (you have to fill it with water before using, or it will be very dirty.) I brought lots of warm clothing. I got very little sleep. I left the place spotless as I always do. There was never any hot water, even after the place warmed up with the sun the next day. No shower. Not enough TP provided. I left early and asked for a refund, which she agreed to. Both host and Airbnb get an F, since I had to beg for a refund, which I have not seen, 2 wks later. I am told I may get 30%. Unbelievable. Airbnb can't be trusted to advocate for guests. This host should be removed.

The bed was super comfy and the view from the room was incredible. I loved watching the ships at night. Port Angeles is a great place for quirky little shops and all the staples. I love any town that has an actual bookstore and this one has 3!
Highly recommend Anitaâ€™s house and do yourself a favor - tack on an extra day or two.

review_text:
Perfect stay for a trip to Olympic National Park.
I live in Seattle and needed somewhere to stay to break up my drive home after visiting Olympic National Park. I also wanted an AirBNB that would be unproblematic due to trying to also secretly plan my proposal.
This stay was everything I needed and beyond for a similar price as the Olympic Inn where I stayed the last time I travelled to Olympic NP. However, this stay was significantly better quality.
(1) The king sized bed is very comfortable; (2) the bathroom was spotless and I love that we had a washer and dryer available; (3) the room itself is spacious, well planned with the sleeping areas, kitchenette, and living area placed in pleasing setting with a wonderful view of the water; (4) The hosts are friendly, thoughtful, and communicative. I did not experience any issues, but I did let them know about my proposal and they ensured our experience was perfect!
There isnâ€™t any more debate left to be had. If youâ€™ve come to this review just go ahead and book it. My only regret was not booking for two nights.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The stay was just a bit out of town, and it was fairly easy to access. The hosts were very friendly and responsive, and the studio was exceptionally clean and tidy. We appreciated the detailed instructions in the binder and the extra blankets and towels if needed.
For it being a studio kitchen, It was still well stocked. We loved the tea and hot pot and used the fridge and freezer as well as the washing machine.
The hosts and their dog live above the studio, so we occasionally heard footsteps, but for the most part it was very quiet (we actually could have used a fan at night for some white noise so we didnâ€™t hear each other!)
Since this stay was at the end of our trip, the one bedroom studio for three of us did start to feel a little small after a couple of days, but we were gone so much enjoying what the area head to offer that we were really only there for sleeping!
There is a great paved trail nearby for running or biking.
